ground_truth: Whip squats and looks over the array of spirits; he settles for vodka. Still kneeling, he unscrews the top from the bottle and runs his fingers over the cold surface of the glass, bringing the bottle to his nose. He replaces the cap, then slowly stands up and sets the bottle on top of the fridge, closes the fridge door, and walks away. Whip swoops up the bottle. Charlie exits an elevator carrying three coffees, with Hugh following. Edmonds knocks, and the men look at each other as Hugh checks the time. Bottles lie everywhere, and Whip lies face down in the bathroom, a large blood stain on the toilet. Harling arrives with a bag slung over his shoulder; Hugh jumps back, and Charlie raises his hands as Harling gestures to Edmonds. Hugh clears the table, and Harling sits beside Whip, cutting the coke, while Whip smiles up at Harling with a torn piece of toilet paper, with a spot of blood, hanging over his eye. Hugh fetches the water as Harling prepares the cigarette. Whip drinks while Harling sucks on the cigarette and hands it to Whip, then cuts more lines of coke and snorts a line, offering a hit to Charlie and Hugh. Whip nods and enters the bathroom as Harling puts on his shades. Whip strides out of the room wearing sunglasses, a Band-Aid on his forehead, and dressed in a suit, with Charlie and Hugh following behind him. They enter an elevator with a woman and a little girl who stares at Whip as Hugh hands him a handkerchief. Whip tilts his head back and presses the cloth to his nostril, removes his glasses, and looks at his reflection on the elevator ceiling before lowering his gaze to the little girl. In the hearing room, cell phone footage of the plane crash is played on a large screen, ending as Whip shifts in his seat and sips some water. Ellen presses a remote, rises, walks around the table at the head of the room, and projects an image on two giant screens. Ellen faces Whip in the middle of the room, slips on her glasses, and checks her notes as Whip glances at Hugh and Charlie. The evidence appears on screen as Ellen nods and leafs through a file, and Charlie and Hugh share a glance. Whip gazes at an enlarged photograph of Katerina on the screen, rolls his tongue, and looks briefly at Hugh and Charlie before studying Katerina's smiling face with pressed lips. He takes a sip of water as Ellen nods, and Whip looks firmly at Ellen, his face shiny with perspiration. Whip looks down, his eyes heavy, as Ellen closes her file and slowly walks to her seat.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Whip crouches and glances over the assortment of liquors; he settles for vodka. Still kneeling, he unscrews the top from the bottle and runs his fingers over the chilly surface of the glass, bringing the bottle to his nose. He replaces the lid, then gradually stands up and places the bottle on top of the fridge, closes the fridge door, and walks away. Whip snatches up the bottle. Charlie exits an elevator carrying three coffees, with Hugh trailing. Edmonds knocks, and the men look at each other as Hugh checks the time. Bottles rest everywhere, and Whip lies prone in the bathroom, a large bloodstain on the toilet. Harling arrives with a bag slung over his shoulder; Hugh jumps back, and Charlie raises his hands as Harling gestures to Edmonds. Hugh clears the table, and Harling sits beside Whip, cutting the coke, while Whip smiles up at Harling with a torn piece of toilet paper, with a spot of blood, hanging over his eye. Hugh retrieves the water as Harling prepares the cigarette. Whip drinks while Harling inhales on the cigarette and hands it to Whip, then cuts more lines of coke and sniffs a line, offering a hit to Charlie and Hugh. Whip nods and enters the bathroom as Harling puts on his shades. Whip strides out of the room wearing sunglasses, a Band-Aid on his forehead, and dressed in a suit, with Charlie and Hugh following behind him. They enter an elevator with a woman and a little girl who stares at Whip as Hugh hands him a handkerchief. Whip tilts his head back and presses the cloth to his nostril, removes his glasses, and looks at his reflection on the elevator ceiling before lowering his gaze to the little girl. In the hearing room, cell phone footage of the plane crash is played on a large screen, ending as Whip shifts in his seat and sips some water. Ellen presses a remote, rises, walks around the table at the head of the room, and projects an image on two gigantic screens. Ellen faces Whip in the middle of the room, slips on her glasses, and checks her notes as Whip glances at Hugh and Charlie. The evidence appears on screen as Ellen nods and leafs through a file, and Charlie and Hugh share a glance. Whip gazes at an enlarged photograph of Katerina on the screen, rolls his tongue, and looks briefly at Hugh and Charlie before studying Katerina's smiling face with pressed lips. He takes a sip of water as Ellen nods, and Whip looks intently at Ellen, his face shiny with perspiration. Whip looks down, his eyes heavy, as Ellen closes her file and slowly walks to her seat.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Whip squats, and the array of spirits is looked over by him; vodka is settled on by him. Still kneeling, the top is unscrewed from the bottle by him, and the cold surface of the glass is run over by his fingers, bringing the bottle to his nose. The cap is replaced by him, then he stands up slowly and the bottle is set on top of the fridge by him, the fridge door is closed, and away he walks. The bottle is swooped up by Whip. Charlie exits an elevator, three coffees are carried by him, with Hugh following. Edmonds knocks, and each other is looked at by the men as the time is checked by Hugh. Bottles are lying everywhere, and in the bathroom, Whip is lying face down, with a large blood stain on the toilet. Harling arrives with a bag slung over his shoulder; Hugh jumps back, and as Harling gestures to Edmonds, Charlie raises his hands. The table is cleared by Hugh, and beside Whip, Harling sits, the coke is cut by him, while up at Harling, Whip smiles with a torn piece of toilet paper, with a spot of blood, hanging over his eye. The water is fetched by Hugh as the cigarette is prepared by Harling. Whip drinks while the cigarette is sucked on by Harling and handed to Whip, then more lines of coke are cut and a line is snorted by Harling, who offers Charlie and Hugh a hit. Whip nods and the bathroom is entered by him as Harling puts on his shades. The room is strode out of by Whip wearing sunglasses, a Band-Aid on his forehead, and dressed in a suit, with Charlie and Hugh following behind him. An elevator is entered by them with a woman and a little girl, who stares at Whip as a handkerchief is handed to him by Hugh. Whip tilts his head back, the cloth is pressed to his nostril by him, his glasses are removed, and his reflection on the elevator ceiling is looked at before his gaze is lowered to the little girl. In the hearing room, cell phone footage of the plane crash is played on a large screen, ending as his seat is shifted in and some water is sipped by Whip. A remote is pressed by Ellen, she rises, the table at the head of the room is walked around by her, and an image is projected on two giant screens. Ellen faces Whip in the middle of the room, her glasses are slipped on by her, and her notes are checked as Hugh and Charlie are glanced at by Whip. The evidence appears on screen as Ellen nods and a file is leafed through by her, and a glance is shared by Charlie and Hugh. An enlarged photograph of Katerina on the screen is gazed at by Whip, his tongue is rolled, and Hugh and Charlie are briefly looked at before Katerina's smiling face with pressed lips is studied. A sip of water is taken by him as Ellen nods, and firmly Ellen is looked at by Whip, his face shiny with perspiration. Whip looks down, his eyes heavy, as her file is closed by Ellen and her seat is slowly walked to by her.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Whip examines the spirits and chooses vodka. Kneeling, he unscrews the bottle, feels the cold glass, and sniffs it. He caps it, stands, places it on the fridge, closes the door, and leaves. Whip grabs the bottle. Charlie exits an elevator with three coffees, followed by Hugh. Edmonds knocks, and the men exchange glances as Hugh checks the time. Bottles are scattered, and Whip lies face down in the bathroom with a bloodstained toilet. Harling arrives with a bag; Hugh jumps back, and Charlie raises his hands as Harling gestures to Edmonds. Hugh clears the table, and Harling sits beside Whip, cutting coke. Whip smiles at Harling with a bloody toilet paper piece over his eye. Hugh fetches water as Harling prepares a cigarette. Whip drinks while Harling smokes and hands it to Whip, then cuts more coke, snorts, and offers it to Charlie and Hugh. Whip nods and enters the bathroom as Harling dons shades. Whip exits wearing sunglasses, a Band-Aid on his forehead, and a suit, with Charlie and Hugh following. They enter an elevator with a woman and a little girl who stares at Whip as Hugh gives him a handkerchief. Whip tilts his head back, presses the cloth to his nostril, removes his glasses, and looks at his reflection before lowering his gaze to the girl. In the hearing room, cell phone footage of the plane crash plays on a large screen, ending as Whip shifts and sips water. Ellen uses a remote, walks around the table, and projects an image on two screens. She faces Whip, puts on glasses, and checks notes as Whip glances at Hugh and Charlie. Evidence appears on screen as Ellen nods and flips through a file, and Charlie and Hugh exchange a look. Whip gazes at an enlarged photo of Katerina, rolls his tongue, and briefly looks at Hugh and Charlie before studying Katerina's smiling face. He sips water as Ellen nods, and Whip looks firmly at Ellen, his face shiny with sweat. Whip looks down, eyes heavy, as Ellen closes her file and returns to her seat.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Whip examines the spirits and chooses vodka. Kneeling, he unscrews the bottle, feels the cold glass, sniffs it, then caps it and places it on the fridge before leaving. Charlie exits an elevator with coffees, followed by Hugh. Edmonds knocks, and they exchange glances as Hugh checks the time. Bottles are scattered, and Whip lies face down in the bathroom with a bloodstained toilet. Harling arrives, startling Hugh and Charlie, and gestures to Edmonds. Hugh clears the table, and Harling sits with Whip, cutting coke. Whip smiles at Harling with a bloody tissue on his eye. Hugh fetches water as Harling prepares a cigarette. Whip drinks, Harling smokes, and offers coke to Charlie and Hugh. Whip nods and enters the bathroom as Harling dons shades. Whip emerges in sunglasses, a Band-Aid on his forehead, and a suit, with Charlie and Hugh following. They enter an elevator with a woman and girl who stares at Whip. Hugh gives him a handkerchief, and Whip presses it to his nose, removes his glasses, and looks at his reflection before glancing at the girl. In the hearing room, plane crash footage plays, and Whip shifts and drinks water. Ellen uses a remote, walks around, and projects an image on screens. She faces Whip, checks her notes, and Whip glances at Hugh and Charlie. Evidence appears as Ellen nods and reviews a file, and Charlie and Hugh exchange looks. Whip studies a photo of Katerina, sips water, and looks at Ellen, sweating. He looks down as Ellen closes her file and returns to her seat.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Whip, with a focused expression, squats down and carefully surveys the extensive array of spirits before him; after a moment of contemplation, he decides on a bottle of vodka. Still in a kneeling position, he meticulously unscrews the top from the bottle and gently runs his fingers over the cold, smooth surface of the glass, bringing the bottle closer to his nose to take in its aroma. Satisfied, he replaces the cap, then slowly rises to his feet, setting the bottle on top of the fridge. He closes the fridge door with a soft click and walks away with a purposeful stride. Whip then swoops up the bottle once more. Meanwhile, Charlie emerges from an elevator, balancing three steaming cups of coffee, with Hugh trailing closely behind him. Edmonds knocks, prompting the men to exchange glances as Hugh checks the time on his watch. Bottles are scattered everywhere, and Whip is found lying face down in the bathroom, a large, ominous blood stain marking the toilet. Harling arrives, a bag casually slung over his shoulder; Hugh jumps back in surprise, and Charlie instinctively raises his hands as Harling gestures towards Edmonds. Hugh quickly clears the table, making space for Harling, who sits down beside Whip, cutting lines of coke, while Whip looks up at Harling with a smile, a torn piece of toilet paper with a spot of blood hanging over his eye. Hugh fetches a glass of water as Harling prepares a cigarette. Whip takes a drink while Harling inhales from the cigarette and then hands it to Whip, proceeding to cut more lines of coke and snort a line, offering a hit to both Charlie and Hugh. Whip nods in agreement and heads into the bathroom as Harling casually puts on his shades. Whip strides confidently out of the room, now wearing sunglasses, a Band-Aid on his forehead, and dressed sharply in a suit, with Charlie and Hugh following closely behind him. They enter an elevator alongside a woman and a little girl, who stares curiously at Whip as Hugh discreetly hands him a handkerchief. Whip tilts his head back slightly and presses the cloth to his nostril, then removes his glasses to look at his reflection on the elevator ceiling before lowering his gaze to meet the little girl's eyes. In the hearing room, cell phone footage of the plane crash is played on a large screen, concluding as Whip shifts uncomfortably in his seat and takes a sip of water. Ellen, holding a remote, rises from her seat, walks around the table at the head of the room, and projects an image onto two giant screens. Ellen faces Whip in the center of the room, slips on her glasses, and checks her notes as Whip glances over at Hugh and Charlie. The evidence appears on the screen as Ellen nods and leafs through a file, while Charlie and Hugh exchange a knowing glance. Whip gazes intently at an enlarged photograph of Katerina on the screen, rolls his tongue thoughtfully, and looks briefly at Hugh and Charlie before returning his attention to Katerina's smiling face with pressed lips. He takes another sip of water as Ellen nods, and Whip looks firmly at Ellen, his face shiny with perspiration. Whip lowers his gaze, his eyes heavy with emotion, as Ellen closes her file and slowly walks back to her seat.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With a focused and determined expression etched across his face, Whip lowers himself into a squat, taking great care as he surveys the extensive and diverse array of spirits displayed before him; after a thoughtful moment of contemplation, he makes the decision to select a bottle of vodka. Remaining in a kneeling position, he meticulously unscrews the top from the carefully chosen bottle and gently runs his fingers over the cold, smooth surface of the glass. He then brings the bottle closer to his nose, inhaling deeply to take in its distinct aroma. Feeling satisfied, he replaces the cap securely, then slowly rises to his feet, setting the bottle on top of the fridge with deliberate care. He closes the fridge door with a soft click and walks away with a purposeful stride. Soon after, Whip retrieves the bottle once more. Meanwhile, Charlie emerges from an elevator, skillfully balancing three steaming cups of coffee in his hands, with Hugh following closely behind him. Edmonds knocks at the door, prompting the three men to exchange quick glances as Hugh checks the time on his watch. Bottles are scattered everywhere, and Whip is found lying face down in the bathroom, a large, ominous blood stain marking the toilet. Harling arrives with a casual air, a bag nonchalantly slung over his shoulder; Hugh jumps back in surprise, and Charlie instinctively raises his hands as Harling gestures towards Edmonds. Quickly, Hugh clears the table, making room for Harling, who sits down beside Whip, cutting lines of coke, while Whip looks up at Harling with a smile and a torn piece of toilet paper with a spot of blood hanging precariously over his eye. Hugh fetches a glass of water as Harling prepares a cigarette. Whip takes a drink while Harling inhales deeply from the cigarette and then hands it over to Whip. Harling proceeds to cut more lines of coke and snorts a line, offering a hit to both Charlie and Hugh. Whip nods in agreement and heads into the bathroom just as Harling casually puts on his shades. With newfound confidence, Whip strides out of the room, now wearing sunglasses, a Band-Aid on his forehead, and looking sharp in a suit, with Charlie and Hugh trailing closely behind him. They enter an elevator alongside a woman and a little girl, who stares curiously at Whip as Hugh discreetly passes him a handkerchief. Whip tilts his head back slightly and presses the cloth to his nostril, then removes his glasses to examine his reflection on the elevator ceiling before lowering his gaze to meet the little girl's inquisitive eyes. In the ensuing hearing room, cell phone footage of the plane crash is played on a large screen, concluding as Whip shifts uncomfortably in his seat and takes a sip of water. Ellen, holding a remote in her hands, rises from her seat, walks around the table at the head of the room, and projects an image onto two giant screens. Ellen faces Whip in the center of the room, slips on her glasses, and checks her notes as Whip glances over at Hugh and Charlie with a look of subtle anticipation. The evidence appears on the screen as Ellen nods and leafs through a file, while Charlie and Hugh exchange a knowing glance. Whip gazes intently at an enlarged photograph of Katerina on the screen, rolls his tongue thoughtfully inside his mouth, and looks briefly at Hugh and Charlie before returning his attention to Katerina's smiling face with pressed lips. He takes another sip of water as Ellen nods, and Whip looks firmly and steadily at Ellen, his face shiny with perspiration. Whip lowers his gaze, his eyes heavy with emotion, as Ellen closes her file and slowly walks back to her seat.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Whip squats down, bringing himself closer to the ground, and carefully surveys the array of spirits before him, his eyes scanning each bottle until he decides on vodka. Remaining in his kneeling position, he reaches out and unscrews the top from the vodka bottle, feeling the coolness of the glass against his fingertips. He brings the bottle closer to his face, inhaling the distinct aroma of the vodka. After a moment, he replaces the cap with deliberate care, then slowly rises to his feet, ensuring his balance, and places the bottle on top of the fridge. He gently closes the fridge door and turns to walk away. In a swift motion, Whip swoops up the bottle again. Meanwhile, Charlie exits an elevator, carefully balancing three coffees in his hands, with Hugh following closely behind him. Edmonds knocks, prompting the men to exchange glances as Hugh checks the time on his watch. The scene shifts to a chaotic bathroom where bottles are strewn across the floor, and Whip lies face down, a large blood stain marking the toilet. Harling arrives, a bag slung over his shoulder, causing Hugh to jump back in surprise while Charlie raises his hands defensively as Harling gestures towards Edmonds. Hugh quickly clears the table, making space for Harling to sit beside Whip. Harling begins cutting the coke, and Whip, with a torn piece of toilet paper stained with blood hanging over his eye, smiles up at Harling. Hugh fetches a glass of water as Harling prepares a cigarette. Whip takes a drink while Harling inhales from the cigarette and then passes it to Whip. Harling cuts more lines of coke, snorts one, and offers a hit to Charlie and Hugh. Whip nods in acknowledgment and heads to the bathroom as Harling puts on his sunglasses. Whip strides confidently out of the room, now wearing sunglasses, a Band-Aid on his forehead, and dressed in a suit, with Charlie and Hugh trailing behind him. They enter an elevator alongside a woman and a little girl who stares curiously at Whip. Hugh discreetly hands Whip a handkerchief, prompting Whip to tilt his head back and press the cloth to his nostril. He removes his sunglasses and catches a glimpse of his reflection on the elevator ceiling before lowering his gaze to meet the little girl's eyes. In the hearing room, cell phone footage of the plane crash plays on a large screen, capturing everyone's attention until it ends, at which point Whip shifts in his seat and takes a sip of water. Ellen, holding a remote, rises from her seat, walks around the table at the head of the room, and projects an image onto two giant screens. She faces Whip in the center of the room, slips on her glasses, and checks her notes while Whip glances at Hugh and Charlie for reassurance. The evidence appears on the screen as Ellen nods and flips through a file, and Charlie and Hugh exchange a knowing glance. Whip's gaze fixes on an enlarged photograph of Katerina displayed on the screen. He rolls his tongue thoughtfully and briefly looks at Hugh and Charlie before focusing on Katerina's smiling face with pressed lips. He takes another sip of water as Ellen nods, and Whip meets her gaze with determination, his face glistening with perspiration. His eyes grow heavy as he looks down, and Ellen closes her file, walking slowly back to her seat.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Whip examines the array of spirits and chooses vodka. He unscrews the bottle, inhales its aroma, then stands and places it on the fridge before walking away. Charlie exits an elevator with coffees, followed by Hugh. Edmonds knocks, prompting Hugh to check the time as they exchange glances. The scene reveals bottles scattered and Whip face down in the bathroom with a bloodstained toilet. Harling arrives, causing Hugh to jump back and Charlie to raise his hands as Harling gestures to Edmonds. Hugh clears the table for Harling, who sits beside Whip, preparing cocaine while Whip smiles with a blood-stained tissue on his eye. Hugh fetches water as Harling prepares a cigarette. Whip drinks, Harling smokes, and then offers cocaine to Charlie and Hugh. Whip nods and heads to the bathroom as Harling dons sunglasses. Whip emerges in sunglasses, a Band-Aid on his forehead, and a suit, with Charlie and Hugh following. They enter an elevator with a woman and a little girl who stares at Whip. Hugh hands him a handkerchief, and Whip presses it to his nostril, removes his glasses, and looks at his reflection before meeting the girl's gaze. In the hearing room, cell phone footage of the plane crash plays on a large screen. Ellen rises, projects an image on two screens, and faces Whip, checking her notes as Whip glances at Hugh and Charlie. The evidence appears, and Charlie and Hugh exchange a glance. Whip studies a photograph of Katerina, then looks at Hugh and Charlie before focusing on her smiling face. He sips water as Ellen nods, and Whip meets her gaze, perspiring. He looks down as Ellen closes her file and returns to her seat.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Whip squats and looks over the array of spirits which includes rare and expensive bottles from around the world; he settles for vodka, a spirit known for its clean taste and widespread popularity. Still kneeling, he unscrews the top from the bottle and runs his fingers over the cold surface of the glass, bringing the bottle to his nose to savor the crisp scent. He replaces the cap, then slowly stands up and sets the bottle on top of the fridge, a vintage model from the 1970s known for its oversized doors, closes the fridge door, and walks away. Whip swoops up the bottle. Charlie exits an elevator carrying three coffees from a local café renowned for its artisanal brews, with Hugh following. Edmonds, who is known for his punctuality, knocks, and the men look at each other as Hugh checks the time on his smart watch. Bottles lie everywhere, remnants of a chaotic night, and Whip lies face down in the bathroom, a large blood stain from a broken nose on the toilet. Harling, renowned for his quick fixes, arrives with a bag slung over his shoulder; Hugh jumps back, and Charlie raises his hands as Harling gestures to Edmonds. Hugh clears the table, and Harling sits beside Whip, cutting the coke, a reference to cocaine, while Whip smiles up at Harling with a torn piece of toilet paper, with a spot of blood, hanging over his eye. Hugh fetches the water as Harling prepares the cigarette using a lighter adorned with a skull emblem. Whip drinks while Harling sucks on the cigarette, a menthol brand favored for its cooling sensation, and hands it to Whip, then cuts more lines of coke and snorts a line, offering a hit to Charlie and Hugh. Whip nods and enters the bathroom as Harling puts on his shades, an expensive designer brand known for its dark lenses. Whip strides out of the room wearing sunglasses, a Band-Aid on his forehead, and dressed in a suit custom-tailored in Italy, with Charlie and Hugh following behind him. They enter an elevator with a woman and a little girl who stares at Whip, intrigued by his unusual appearance, as Hugh hands him a handkerchief. Whip tilts his head back and presses the cloth to his nostril, removes his glasses, and looks at his reflection on the elevator ceiling, a polished metal surface, before lowering his gaze to the little girl. In the hearing room, a place steeped in silence and authority, cell phone footage of the plane crash, an event which made international headlines, is played on a large screen, ending as Whip shifts in his seat and sips some water. Ellen, known for her meticulous attention to detail, presses a remote, rises, walks around the table at the head of the room, and projects an image on two giant screens. Ellen faces Whip in the middle of the room, slips on her glasses, a signature move before addressing key points, and checks her notes as Whip glances at Hugh and Charlie. The evidence appears on screen as Ellen nods and leafs through a file, a thick binder of documents, and Charlie and Hugh share a glance. Whip gazes at an enlarged photograph of Katerina, whose tragic loss had been deeply felt, on the screen, rolls his tongue, and looks briefly at Hugh and Charlie before studying Katerina's smiling face with pressed lips. He takes a sip of water as Ellen nods, and Whip looks firmly at Ellen, his face shiny with perspiration. Whip looks down, his eyes heavy, as Ellen closes her file, an action that signifies the closing of a chapter, and slowly walks to her seat.

Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Whip drinks while Harling sucks on the cigarette and hands it to Whip then cuts more lines of coke and snorts a line offering a hit to Charlie and Hugh. Whip nods and enters the bathroom as Harling puts on his shades. Whip strides out of the room wearing sunglasses a BandAid on his forehead and dressed in a suit with Charlie and Hugh following behind him. They enter an elevator with a woman and a little girl who stares at Whip as Hugh hands him a handkerchief. Whip tilts his head back and presses the cloth to his nostril removes his glasses and looks at his reflection on the elevator ceiling before lowering his gaze to the little girl. In the hearing room cell phone footage of the plane crash is played on a large screen ending as Whip shifts in his seat and sips some water. Ellen presses a remote rises walks around the table at the head of the room and projects an image on two giant screens. Ellen faces Whip in the middle of the room slips on her glasses and checks her notes as Whip glances at Hugh and Charlie. The evidence appears on screen as Ellen nods and leafs through a file and Charlie and Hugh share a glance. Whip gazes at an enlarged photograph of Katerina on the screen rolls his tongue and looks briefly at Hugh and Charlie before studying Katerina's smiling face with pressed lips. He takes a sip of water as Ellen nods and Whip looks firmly at Ellen his face shiny with perspiration. Whip looks down his eyes heavy as Ellen closes her file and slowly walks to her seat.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Whip squats and looks over the array of spirits he settles for vodka. Still kneeling he unscrews the top from the bottle and runs his fingers over the cold surface of the glass bringing the bottle to his nose. He replaces the cap then slowly stands up and sets the bottle on top of the fridge closes the fridge door and walks away. Whip swoops up the bottle. Charlie exits an elevator carrying three coffees with Hugh following. Edmonds knocks and the men look at each other as Hugh checks the time. Ellen presses a remote rises walks around the table at the head of the room and projects an image on two giant screens. Ellen faces Whip in the middle of the room slips on her glasses and checks her notes as Whip glances at Hugh and Charlie. The evidence appears on screen as Ellen nods and leafs through a file and Charlie and Hugh share a glance. Whip gazes at an enlarged photograph of Katerina on the screen rolls his tongue and looks briefly at Hugh and Charlie before studying Katerina's smiling face with pressed lips. He takes a sip of water as Ellen nods and Whip looks firmly at Ellen his face shiny with perspiration. Whip looks down his eyes heavy as Ellen closes her file and slowly walks to her seat.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Whip squats and looks over the array of spirits he settles for vodka. Still kneeling he unscrews the top from the bottle and runs his fingers over the cold surface of the glass bringing the bottle to his nose. He replaces the cap then slowly stands up and sets the bottle on top of the fridge closes the fridge door and walks away. He takes a sip of water as Ellen nods and Whip looks firmly at Ellen his face shiny with perspiration. Whip looks down his eyes heavy as Ellen closes her file and slowly walks to her seat.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Flick squats and scans over the collection of pastries; she chooses a doughnut. Still crouching, she unwinds the wrapper from the pastry and brushes her fingers over the warm texture of the icing, bringing the doughnut to her lips. She rewraps the wrapper, then slowly rises and places the doughnut on top of the shelf, closes the cupboard door, and runs away. Flick scoops up the doughnut. Marley exits a staircase carrying three pizzas, with Glenn trailing. Jordan taps, and the folks glance at each other as Glenn checks the clock. Toys lie everywhere, and Flick lies face down in the bedroom, a large red stain on the carpet. Sam arrives with a sack slung over her shoulder; Glenn leaps forward, and Marley raises her feet as Sam points to Jordan. Glenn clears the counter, and Sam sits beside Flick, slicing the cake, while Flick grins up at Sam with a ripped piece of cloth, with a dab of paint, hanging over her cheek. Glenn grabs the milk as Sam prepares the candy. Flick sips while Sam chews on the candy and offers it to Flick, then slices more pieces of cake and devours a slice, offering a piece to Marley and Glenn. Flick nods and steps into the bedroom as Sam puts on his hat. Flick marches out of the chamber wearing goggles, a bandage on her chin, and dressed in overalls, with Marley and Glenn trailing after her. They enter a staircase with a man and a young boy who gawks at Flick as Glenn hands her a tissue. Flick tilts her head forward and presses the fabric to her lip, removes her goggles, and glances at her reflection on the staircase railing before lowering her gaze to the young boy. In the meeting room, camera footage of the car crash is displayed on a big screen, ending as Flick shifts in her chair and gulps some juice. Alex clicks a pen, stands, strolls around the desk at the front of the room, and projects a picture on two massive boards. Alex faces Flick in the center of the room, slips on her hat, and checks her papers as Flick peeks at Glenn and Marley. The pictures appear on screen as Alex nods and sifts through a binder, and Marley and Glenn exchange a look. Flick stares at an oversized drawing of Rebecca on the board, licks his lips, and glances briefly at Glenn and Marley before examining Rebecca's grinning portrait with sealed lips. She takes a swallow of juice as Alex nods, and Flick stares firmly at Alex, her face glistening with sweat. Flick looks down, her eyes droopy, as Alex closes her binder and gradually walks to her chair.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Whip examines an array of spirits and chooses vodka but hesitates, placing it back. Charlie and Hugh arrive as Edmonds knocks, revealing a scene of chaos with Whip face down in the bathroom. Harling enters, joining a tense atmosphere, and together they prepare drugs, with Whip partaking. Whip emerges transformed in a suit, accompanied by Charlie and Hugh, encountering a woman and a little girl in the elevator. During a hearing, footage of a plane crash is shown, with Ellen presenting evidence. Whip, visibly stressed, observes a photograph of Katerina, glancing at Hugh and Charlie. Ellen concludes her presentation as Whip wrestles with his emotions and the weight of the situation.
